source.title: Lucy Powell elected Labour's deputy leader

facts: Lucy Powell has been elected as Labour's new deputy leader
The election was triggered by Angela Rayner' end resignation last month.
Powell defeated Education Secretary Bridget Phillipson in the race for deputy leadership of the party.
During her victory speech, Powell promised to bring voices who believe government is not bold enough into focus within their party
She also criticized Reform UK and stated that Labour cannot win support by trying to 'out-Reform' them.

neutral.headline: Lucy Powell elected as new deputy leader of the Labour Party.
